lines.text: Care for a little necrophilia? Hmmm?
Give my best to Alison and the twins.
Triplets.
Triplets? My how time flies
I only know you got the wrong man.
Information Transit got the wrong man. I got the *right* man. The wrong one was delivered to me as the right man, I accepted him on good faith as the right man. Was I wrong?
Excuse me, Dawson, can you put me through to Mr. Helpmann's office?
I'm afraid I can't sir. You have to go through the proper channels.
And you can't tell me what the proper channels are, because that's classified information?
I'm glad to see the Ministry's continuing its tradition of recruiting the brightest and best, sir.
Thank you, Dawson.
This is your receipt for your husband... and this is my receipt for your receipt.
Listen, kid, we're all in it together.
[last lines]
He's got away from us, Jack.
'Fraid you're right, Mr. Helpmann. He's gone.
Bloody paperwork. Huh!
I suppose one has to expect a certain amount.

Why? I came into this game for the action, the excitement. Go anywhere, travel light, get in, get out, wherever there's trouble, a man alone. Now they got the whole country sectioned off, you can't make a move without a form.
What is this mess? An empty desk is an efficient desk.
My name's Lowry. Sam Lowry. I've been told to report to Mr. Warrenn.
Thirtieth floor, sir. You're expected.
Um... don't you want to search me?
No sir.
Do you want to see my ID?
No need, sir.
But I could be anybody.
No you couldn't sir. This is Information Retrieval.
Can you fix it?
No, I can't. But I can bypass it with one of these.
[Holds up a bizarre device]
What would you like for Christmas?
My own credit card.
Bad sportsmanship. A ruthless minority of people seem to have forgotten good old-fashioned virtues. They just can't stand seeing the other fellow win. If these people would just play the game...

[on Buttle]
You see? The population census has got him down as "dormanted." Uh, the Central Collective Storehouse computer has got him down as "deleted."
Hang on.
[goes to a computer terminal]
Information Retrieval has got him down as "inoperative." And there's another one - security has got him down as "excised." Administration has got him down as "completed."
He's dead.
Don't fight it son. Confess quickly! If you hold out too long you could jeopardize your credit rating.
Bloody typical, they've gone back to metric without telling us.
It's not my fault that Buttle's heart condition didn't appear on Tuttle's file!
Is that one of your triplets?
Yeah, probably.
How do you account for the fact that the bombing campaign has been going on for thirteen years?
Beginners' luck.

[dancing wildly, while singing in an absurdly high soprano]
A-a-a-a-a-a-A-a-a-a-a-a-a-A-a-a-a-a-a-a-A-A! Mrs Ida Lowry requests the pleasure of your COMPANYYYY! At her APARTMENT TONIIIIGHTT! For eight thirtee-EE-ee-ee-ee-ee-ee-EE, to MIDNIGHTTT! To celebrate the completion of her recent cosmetic SURGERYYY! E-e-e-e-e-e-E-e-e-e-e-e-E! wwwWWAAAAAAIIIIIIIII!
[very long pause, Sam glances around nervously]
ummm... Thanks.
It's reply paid.
Is it?
[telegram girl nods]
oh... um... two, three,
[singing]
Mother, I sorry that I am unable to come to your parrrttty...
You DON'T have to sing it!
I don't?

[no meals yet]
Salt?
Has anybody seen Sam Lowry?
There you are, your own number on your very own door. And behind that door, your very own office! Welcome to the team, DZ-015
Mistakes? We don't make mistakes.
...well, that's a pipe of a different color.
My good friends call me Harry.
Tuttle!
Call me Harry!
What have you done with his body?
Just me and my little knife! Snip snip - slice slice... can you believe it?
Where'd you get this from, eh? Out yer nostril?
All you've got to do is blow your nose and it's fixed, in't it?
Are you alright?
Yeah.
Well, you don't deserve to be!
Put it on, big boy. I won't look at your willy.
There's been a little complication with my complication
[last lines]
He's got away from us, Jack.
Afraid you're right, Mr. Helpmann. He's gone.
Mmm.
Well...
Sam! Can't you do something about these terrorists?
It's my lunch hour. Besides, it's not my department.
Listen, this old system of yours could be on fire and I couldn't even turn on the kitchen tap without filling out a 27b/6... Bloody paperwork.
It's been confusion from the word go!
Until this whole thing blows over, just stay away from me.
Yes... No... I don't know. I don't know what I want.
Mr. Helpmann, I'm keen to get into Information Retrieval. Mr. Helpmann, I'm dying to get at this woman... no, no, no.
Yes, I always used to wonder if she wore falsies. False ears...
Sorry, I'm a bit of a stickler for paperwork. Where would we be if we didn't follow the correct procedures?

I assure you, Mrs. Buttle, the Ministry is very scrupulous about following up and eradicating any error. If you have any complaints which you'd like to make, I'd be more than happy to send you the appropriate forms.
We're fielding all their strokes, running a lot of them out, and pretty consistently knocking them for six. I'd say they're nearly out of the game.
Jill? Yes... Sam I think I ought to tell you. I'm afraid she's upped stumps and retired to the pavillion. Thrown in the towel.
All I can say is don't fall at the last fence. The finishing post's in sight. See you in the paddock... keep your eye on the ball.
Faces are a doddle compared to tits and ass. No hairline.
Computers are my forte!
This is information retrieval not information dispersal.
[first lines]
We do the work, you do the pleasure.
Hi, there. I want to talk to you about ducts.
[Sam is arguing with his mother while Jaffe tries to perform cosmetic surgery on her]
Mr. Lowry, can you wait in reception? You're giving her wrinkles.

[about his wife's cosmetic surgery]
Remember how they used to stick out?
Oh, um yes. I always used to wonder if they were real.
My ears?
[Lime blows the dust from the keyboard, then presses a key. waits for something to happen]

[worried and somewhat frustrated]
Sod it, it's broken!
You haven't switched it on.
[presses a key, the computer starts]
Oh, yes.
[looks at Sam, waiting for him to say something]

[convincingly]
Look, you're putting me off, standing there. Why don't you go back to your office and I'll give you a knock when I finish?
Dead? That's awful. We'll never get rid of the bloody thing now!
Suspicion builds Confidence.
we're all in it together.
So you don't trust me?
